thread.title: ‘Empire Records’ turns 20!

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: ‘Empire Records’ turns 20!
text:
Warner Brothers/courtesy Everett Collection The 1995 cult classic movie, "Empire Records," turns 20 years old on Oct. 20. Happy Rex Manning Day!
Twenty years ago Tuesday, the comedy-drama “ Empire Records ” was released in movie theaters across America.
Although the film only grossed $303,841 at the box office, it achieved cult status across multiple generations.
Set in an independent record store facing permanent closure, “Empire Records” remains to some a beloved coming-of-age film about friendship, being true to oneself, music and standing up to authority.
The leading stars of the film also became fixtures in Hollywood, as fans continue to follow their every move.
Here is a list of those who have since kept dancing to the beat of their own drum since appearing in the film:
Jack Plunkett/Jack Plunkett/Invision/AP Actress Liv Tyler is a mother of two boys - Milo Langdon and Sailor Gardner. Chris Pizzello/Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP Renée Zellweger recently came under fire due to rumors of plastic surgery. Arthur Mola/Arthur Mola/Invision/AP Ethan Embry's birth name is Ethan Randall. Andy Kropa/Andy Kropa/Invision/AP Debi Mazar starred in some of music icon Madonna's music videos and did her makeup as well. Previous Next Enlarge Liv Tyler — as Corey Mason
Daughter of Aerosmith lead singer Steven Tyler, Liv Tyler was one of the breakout stars of “Empire Records.”
Tyler, along with her goody two-shoes character, Corey Mason in the movie, became a teenage style icon and sex symbol.
From her rise to stardom in the 1990s, Tyler acted in a wide range of films and television series, such as “That Thing You Do!,” “The Lord of the Rings” trilogy, “The Incredible Hulk” and “The Leftovers.”
The actress and mother of two recently spoke out against ageism in Hollywood .
Renée Zellweger — as Gina
Before her leading lady roles in the “Bridget Jones” movies and “Jerry Maguire,” Renée Zellweger found her footing as Gina, Empire Records’ resident party girl.
Zellweger’s name is certainly recognized in Hollywood circles, having climbed the ladder to gain career-defining roles in movies such as “Chicago,” “Nurse Betty,” “Me, Myself & Irene,” and “White Oleander.”
She is also an Academy Award, BAFTA Award, Golden Globe and Critics’ Choice Movie Awards winner for Best Supporting Actress in the 2003 war drama, “Cold Mountain,” and a Golden Globe Award winner for her roles in the movies “Nurse Betty” and “Chicago.”
Coming out in 2016, the actress is set to entertain viewers in another crowd-pleasing Bridget Jones movie based on the book, “Bridget Jones’s Baby.”
Ethan Embry — as Mark
Ethan Embry was a successful child actor who designed a good film and television career for himself.
After “Empire Records,” Embry shared his acting prowess in other classic, generation-defining movies such as “Can’t Hardly Wait” and “Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle.”
The entertainer has not slowed down in adding to his already impressive resume.
In 2015, he portrayed two pivotal characters in two very influential television shows — Carter in “The Walking Dead” and Coyote Bergstein in Netflix’s “ Grace and Frankie .”
Debi Mazar — as Jane
Queens-born, Manhattan-bred Debi Mazar is close friends with legendary pop music icon Madonna and hosts a culinary television series, “ Extra Virgin ,” with her husband on the Cooking Channel.
It may seem as though the actress has had a privileged upbringing, but has otherwise worked hard for several decades in the entertainment business.
After acting in two of director Spike Lee’s most controversial, “Malcolm X” and “Jungle Fever,” “Empire Records” was the movie that put Mazar on a path to a golden acting career.
She currently stars as Maggie in the praised TV Land series, “ Younger .”
Eric Charbonneau/Eric Charbonneau/Invision/AP Rory Cochrane attended the LaGuardia High School of Performing Arts in New York City. Jordan Strauss/Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP Robin Tunney starred in the CBS Network television show, "The Mentalist." Richard Shotwell/Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP Johnny Whitworth was born on Halloween in 1975. Previous Next Enlarge Rory Cochrane — as Lucas
Lucas is the lovable, well-meaning nighttime manager of Empire Records, played by the convincing Rory Cochrane.
With a familiar face, Cochrane cornered his talent and luck in securing plum gigs in movies such as “A Scanner Darkly,” also starring Robert Downey Jr., Keanu Reeves and Winona Ryder, “Argo,” “Oculus” and “Black Mass.”
The performer has also enjoyed a long run in the television series “CSI:Miami” as character Tim Speedle.
Robin Tunney — as Debra
For some, Robin Tunney’s name may not sound like a household name.
But, fans of the actress her in roles as Sarah Bailey in the horror-fantasy movie “ The Craft ” or as Veronica Donovan in the television show “ Prison Break ” will cosign for the star otherwise.
However, it can be argued that Tunney’s breakout role was in “Empire Records” as suicidal record store employee Debra.
Post-“Empire Records” fame, the thespian consistently worked in front of the camera.
Her latest film, the biographical drama “ My All American ,” premieres in early November of 2015.
Jordan Strauss/Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP Anthony LaPaglia won a Tony Award for Best Actor in 1998. Dan Steinberg/AP Maxwell Caulfield appeared in the movie "Grease 2" as Michael Carrington. Previous Next Enlarge Johnny Whitworth — as A.J.
Like his “Empire Records” co-star Liv Tyler, Johnny Whitworth was arguably marketed as one of the movie’s male sex symbols both on and off screen.
Anyone familiar with the heartache of unrequited love related to his “Empire Records” character, A.J., who endlessly pined away for Corey’s affection, played by Tyler.
Whitworth’s sex appeal is still undeniable — one of his most recent roles in the NBC drama series “Blindspot” is credited as “ Ruggedly Handsome Man .”
Anthony LaPaglia — as Joe Reaves
The Australian born actor has a steady on-camera career before appearing in “Empire Records” as the cool, yet blunt store manager Joe.
After “Empire Records,” LaPaglia starred in a number of hit television shows, including “Frasier” and “Without a Trace.”
Maxwell Caulfield — as Rex Manning
The 1980s pop idol Rex Manning was the wedge that came between both Liv Tyler and Renée Zellweger’s characters in “Empire Records.”
Maxwell Caulfield, as Manning, depicted his character with accurate conviction.
Not only did his performance in “Empire Records” help seal further acting opportunities for the entertainer, but there is also a real Rex Manning Day (April 8), just like the one seen in the movie, to commemorate the fictional recording artist.
csmith@nydailynews.com
